title: Mavis Pugh
text:
Mavis Gladys Fox Pugh (25 June 1914 – 6 December 2006) was an English actress who made many appearances (typically playing upper-class women) in several sitcoms including "<a href="Dad%27s%20Army">Dad's Army</a>", "<a href="Are%20You%20Being%20Served%3F">Are You Being Served?</a>" and "<a href="Fawlty%20Towers">Fawlty Towers</a>". Her best known role was as Lady Lavender Southwick in all four series of "<a href="You%20Rang%2C%20M%27Lord%3F">You Rang, M'Lord?</a>". Before appearing on television, she had a long and successful career in <a href="repertory%20theatre">repertory theatre</a>, including with the Arthur Brough Players.
Early life.
Pugh was born in <a href="Croydon">Croydon</a>, <a href="Surrey">Surrey</a> in 1914. Her father was a <a href="London">London</a> <a href="solicitor">solicitor</a>, and her acting talent was first noticed while performing in school plays at Downs College in <a href="Folkestone">Folkestone</a>, <a href="Kent">Kent</a>. Pugh won a scholarship to the International School of Acting. Having worked in <a href="repertory">rep</a> in <a href="Amersham">Amersham</a>, <a href="Buckinghamshire">Buckinghamshire</a>, Pugh toured in 1939 with "My Wife's Family" and in 1943 made her <a href="West%20End%20theatre">West End</a> debut in "<a href="Junior%20Miss">Junior Miss</a>". As well as doing several years in rep, Pugh toured <a href="music%20hall">music hall</a>s and clubs with <a href="Hugh%20Paddick">Hugh Paddick</a> with the pair trying to beat each other's ad-libbing.
While performing at the <a href="Golders%20Green%20Hippodrome">Golders Green Hippodrome</a> in 1956, she was spotted by <a href="Jimmy%20Perry">Jimmy Perry</a>, who then invited her to join his rep company at the <a href="Watford%20Palace%20Theatre">Palace Theatre</a> in <a href="Watford">Watford</a>. There she met <a href="John%20Clegg%20%28actor%29">John Clegg</a>, an actor who best known as pianist Gunner Graham in the <a href="BBC">BBC</a> <a href="sitcom">sitcom</a> "<a href="It%20Ain%27t%20Half%20Hot%20Mum">It Ain't Half Hot Mum</a>". They married in 1959.
Later life.
Pugh did not begin her television career until the age of 60, with an appearance in the 1974 "<a href="Dad%27s%20Army">Dad's Army</a>" episode "<a href="The%20Captain%27s%20Car">The Captain's Car</a>". Two years later she appeared in one episode of "<a href="It%20Ain%27t%20Half%20Hot%20Mum">It Ain't Half Hot Mum</a>", titled "Ticket to Blighty", and in "<a href="Are%20You%20Being%20Served%3F">Are You Being Served?</a>" in the episode "<a href="List%20of%20Are%20You%20Being%20Served%3F%20episodes%23Series%20Four%20%281976%29">Fifty Years On</a>". She also appeared in two other "Are You Being Served?" episodes, "<a href="List%20of%20Are%20You%20Being%20Served%3F%20episodes%23Series%205%20%281977%29">Take-over</a>" and "<a href="List%20of%20Are%20You%20Being%20Served%3F%20episodes%23Series%206%20%281978%29">The Club</a>", both as different characters. In 1979, Pugh played Mrs Chase in the "<a href="Fawlty%20Towers">Fawlty Towers</a>" episode "<a href="The%20Kipper%20and%20the%20Corpse">The Kipper and the Corpse</a>". Pugh had small parts in two films, "<a href="The%20Class%20of%20Miss%20MacMichael">The Class of Miss MacMichael</a>" in 1978 and "Brothers and Sisters" in 1980.
Pugh appeared in two episodes of "<a href="Hi-de-Hi%21">Hi-de-Hi!</a>" as The Hon. Winifred Dempster, the aunt of camp entertainments manager Clive Dempster - the 1986 episode "God Bless Our Family" (Series 8) and the 1988 episode "Wedding Bells" (Series 9). From 1987 to 1988, she played Mrs Barrable in four episodes of the <a href="Ronnie%20Corbett">Ronnie Corbett</a> sitcom "<a href="Sorry%21%20%28TV%20series%29">Sorry!</a>". In 1989, she appeared in an episode of "<a href="Alas%20Smith%20and%20Jones">Alas Smith and Jones</a>" and an episode of "<a href="Boon%20%28TV%20series%29">Boon</a>" the following year. The largest role of her television career was that of the porridge-hurling Lady Lavender Southwick in all <a href="List%20of%20You%20Rang%2C%20M%27Lord%3F%20episodes">26 episodes</a> of "<a href="You%20Rang%2C%20M%27Lord%3F">You Rang, M'Lord?</a>", from 1988 to 1993.
Death.
Mavis Pugh died in <a href="Chichester">Chichester</a>, <a href="West%20Sussex">West Sussex</a> on 6 December 2006, aged 92, of natural causes. She was survived by her husband, John Clegg.
